originalText: Mainframe
Start Element
interface
::Suspended in the middle of the pyramid the massive glowing rock hums softly.::
context.global_knowMonoliths
::Focus your mind on the rock.::
::Leave it be.::
::You clear your mind of other thoughts and focus just on the sound of the humming rock and its strange contours.::

::After a while the walls of the pyramid start moving away from you. At first slowly, but soon they begin accelerating. They escape faster and faster, moving light-years away from you, but somehow you can still see them.::
::You try to focus on the rock but its immensity burdens your mind beyond your endurance. Peering into it feels just as difficult to you as lifting it would be.::
::Inversely, the rock shrinks to sub-atomic size. You can no longer see its light, but you can still feel its presence through the humming.::
PE
::In the vastness of space, surrounded by the pyramid's walls, a storm of memories, knowledge, and visions rages around you.::
::They all seem beyond your reach, though.::
::Most of them seem well beyond your reach, but you might be able to glimpse into some of them.::
context.wa_mainframe_vision1
::Focus on the two large objects revolving around one another.::
::Focus on the nearby superheated object.::
::Focus on the pervading background waves.::
English
::Focus on continuously distorting constellation far away.::

::As the Leviathan circles around a red planet, from half a galaxy away an invisible spear is hurled. It warps the space-time as it races towards its target, dislodging planets and shattering stars. These tell-tale signs will arrive too late to warn the creature of its impending doom, though.::
::You attempt to focus on the twin objects, but your mind's eye cannot follow their movement and you are forced to give up.::
::The egg is cold and dark on the outside, but as you pass the membrane you can see and feel the hot core within.::
::The heat makes it too hard for you to focus on this phenomena.::
::Countless thoughts of Godmen race through your head as you let the waves pass through you, but you can only make sense of small fragments.::
::You try to feel and make sense of the background waves but they only make your brain throb.::
::The stars around you start to spin and spiral down into a center from which a celestial wheel emerges.::
::It is as if you're looking at the stars of faraway galaxies though melting glass and you find it impossible to focus your eyes on the constellation.::
::With a sickening screeching the space around you implodes, and just as quick as it expanded, the pyramid reverts back to its previous state.::
::For these giants it is impossible to defend from an enemy who can kill by observing. The Eon of the Beast is over.::
::Immeasurable amounts of energy flow through the invisible network. So much more than they need to rule their domain, but not nearly enough to change their fate.::
::You sense their fear and wonder as they arrive close by. They lament as they learn their fate.::
xpbl
::With each spin of the wheel the constellation is violently reconfigured in full and yet always ends up invoking the same image.::
::Morbid curiosity makes them descend. You feel hatred and anger as they die.::

::The wheel spins faster and faster until in a single instant two shafts of light thrust out of its center, perpendicular to the wheel, along which all the constellations are strung and visible simultaneously.::
::Three are now all that remain.::
